intro: Metrosideros florida var. aurata, commonly known as the Hawaiian flame tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a vivid display during the flowering season. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement, and it thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental tree due to its showy flowers and relatively fast growth rate. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
